Description: Rim sherd of Attic black figure pottery Siana cup; interior: reserved band around rim and glazed black below; exterior: painted black on top of rim; below around lip, painted decoration consisting of ivy leaf pattern.
Curator's comments: There is no evidence of black figure related incision on the sherd. According to the museum register, the sherd may have been found at Naukratis. However, it may belong to vase B380 (British Museum 1885,1213.12), a Siana cup that was found at Siana on Rhodes.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0378) (Phase 1)
